alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 9:43AM PST until December 03 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Smith River Complex burn scar with rates ranging from 0.5 to 1.0 inch per hour will be possible. Residents near the Smith River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
